item.title: First Script! Makes autotyper in VB6
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

ya, sorry, forgot to add the variable part.

Also, use this procedure instead, it has less detectable mouse movements…

[scar]procedure findColor;
begin
if(findColor(x, y, color, x1, x2, y1, y2))Then//If color is found at given coords, continues.
begin
MMouse(x, y, 3, 3);//Moves mouse smoothly to the coords of the color.
wait(100);
Mouse(x, y, 2, 2, true);//Clicks on color
end;
end;[/scar]

And remember to define x and y as integers, and if you have problems with the clicking, do what janilabo said.

Now for the explanation of the mouse procedures.

MMouse(x, y, 3, 3); --x and y just the coords that the mouse will move to(retrieved by the findColor… procedure). The two 3’s means that the mouse will move somewhere within 3 pixels of x and y. It just makes it more humanlike, not clicking in the same exact spot all the time.

Mouse(x, y, 2, 2, true); --x and y are again the coords that the mouse will click on. The two 2’s are once again the same thing as MMouse, this means the mouse will click somewhere within 2 pixels of x and y.

Hope this helps!

Read full topic
item.source: First Script! Makes autotyper in VB6

item.title: First Script! Makes autotyper in VB6
item.dc:creator: @Janilabo Janilabo
item.description:
@Janilabo wrote:

You must declare the variables… (x and y are variables…) So, under program New; put this line:

var x, y : integer; and then it will be working.

If you have problems with clickmouse(x, y, true); (like if it keeps clicking to 0, 0…), after movemouse(x, y);… Then use getmousepos(x, y); before using clickmouse(x, y, true);.

An example (without coordinates and other stuff)

findcolor (if…then)
begin
movemouse
getmousepos
clickmouse
end

Read full topic

item.title: First Script! Makes autotyper in VB6
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

I think you’re looking for something like this…

[scar]procedure findColor;
begin
if(findColor(x, y, color, x1, x2, y1, y2))Then//If color is found at given coords, continues.
begin
moveMouseSmooth(x, y);//Moves mouse smoothly to the coords of the color.
wait(100);
clickMouse(x, y, true);//Clicks on color
end;
end;[/scar]

Hope that helps

Read full topic

item.title: First Script! Makes autotyper in VB6
item.dc:creator: @jrcdude jrcdude
item.description:
@jrcdude wrote:

Well Heres my first Script:

[scar]
program New;
begin

//Openining Visual Basic\
movemouse(28, 757)
clickmouse(28, 757, True);
wait(1000)
movemouse(28, 698)
wait(500)
movemouse(902, 163)
wait(500)
movemouse(608, 186)
wait(100)
ClickMouse(608, 186, True);
wait(2000)
movemouse(344, 257)
ClickMouse(344, 257, True);
moveMouse(666, 414)
clickMouse(666, 414, True);

//Chaning Form Size\
HoldMouse(423, 385, True)
wait(100)
MoveMouse (639, 526);
ReleaseMouse(639, 526, True)
wait(500)

//Add Timer\
MoveMouse(18, 471)
ClickMouse(18, 471, True);
HoldMouse(103, 489, True)
MoveMouse(127, 513)
ReleaseMouse(127, 513,True);
wait(100)

//Change Timer Properties\
MoveMouse(887, 468)
ClickMouse(887, 468, True);
wait(100)
SendKeys(‘300’);
SendKeys(chr(13))
wait(100)
MoveMouse(888, 421)
ClickMouse(888, 421, True);
wait(100)
SendKeys(‘SpamTmr’)
SendKeys(chr(13))
wait(100)

//Add Textbox1\
MoveMouse(19, 219)
ClickMouse(19, 219, True);
HoldMouse(112, 386, True)
MoveMouse(471, 409)
ReleaseMouse(471, 409,True);
wait(100)

//Change Textbox1 Properties\
MoveMouse(920, 421)
ClickMouse(920, 421, True);
wait(100)
SendKeys(‘SpamTxt1’)
SendKeys(chr(13))
HoldMouse(1005, 443, True);
MoveMouse(1004, 528);
ReleaseMouse(1004, 528, True);
MoveMouse(920, 548)
ClickMouse(920, 548, True);
wait(100)
SendKeys(‘Autospammer’)
SendKeys (chr(13))
wait(100)
MoveMouse(919, 535)
ClickMouse(919, 535, True);
wait(100)
SendKeys(‘Enter Text Here’)
Sendkeys (chr(13))
wait(100)

//Add Label1\
MoveMouse(18, 191)
ClickMouse(18, 191, True);
wait(100)
HoldMouse(487, 385, True);
MoveMouse(527, 409)
ReleaseMouse(527, 409, True);

//Change Label1’s Properties\
MoveMouse(919, 534)
ClickMouse(919, 534, True);
wait(100)
SendKeys(‘F12’)
SendKeys(chr(13))
wait(100)

//Change Form’s Properties\
MoveMouse(493, 292)
ClickMouse(493, 292, True);
wait(100)
MoveMouse(919, 501)
ClickMouse(919, 501, True);
wait(100)
SendKeys(‘Autotyper’)
SendKeys(chr(13))
wait(100)

//Add Timer Code\
MoveMouse(142, 199)
ClickMouse(142, 199, True);
wait(100)
SendKeys(‘Option Explicit’)
SendKeys(chr(13))
SendKeys(‘Private Declare Function GetAsyncKeyState Lib “user32” (ByVal vkey As Long) As Integer’)
SendKeys(chr(13))

//Clear End Sub\
HoldMouse(144, 249, True);
MoveMouse(210, 246);
ReleaseMouse(210, 246, True);
wait(100)
SendKeys(’ ')

//Add Keytype Code\
MoveMouse(220, 246)
ClickMouse(220, 246, True);
Wait(100)
SendKeys(chr(13))
wait(10)
SendKeys(chr(13))
wait(10)
SendKeys(‘Private Sub SpamTmr_Timer()’)
SendKeys(chr(13))
SendKeys(‘If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyF12) Then’)
SendKeys(chr(13))
SendKeys(‘SendKeys SpamTxt1.Text’)
SendKeys(chr(13))
SendKeys(‘SendKeys “{Enter}”’)
SendKeys(chr(13))
SendKeys(‘End If’)
SendKeys(chr(13))
SendKeys(‘End Sub’)
wait(100)

//Delete 2nd End Sub\
HoldMouse(149, 375, True);
MoveMouse(220, 375);
ReleaseMouse(220, 375, True);
wait(100)
SendKeys(’ ')

//Close Code Window\
MoveMouse(657, 145)
ClickMouse(657, 145, True);

//Done\
Writeln (‘You now have a fully functional Autotyper’)

end.

[/scar]
